item.title: Report X-2023080884
item.description:
Report X-2023080884

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-11
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found in the north unload at door 54 where it was leaking inside the trailer and was placed into a hazmat bag and taken to QA hut to be processed. DescribePack: One of the bottles had a missing cap which caused all liquid to leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Hazmat bag was placed into a yellow drum where it sit in the hazmat cage waiting for disposition.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Drum was found leaking at the 414-loading door where it was placed into a hazmat bag and taken to QA to be processed. DescribePack: Drum contain a puncture hole on top near the lid. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Drum was placed into a white pail where it is in the hazmat processing cage waiting for disposition.

item.title: Report E-2023080925
item.description:
Report E-2023080925

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-05T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-16
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 16, 2023, two (2) 2.5-gallon jugs of sodium hydroxide were punctured by a forklift and released approximately one and a half (1.5) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the site. GES personnel removed the damaged containers and wiped the area with absorbent pads. All sodium hydroxide-impacted material was containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023080839
item.description:
Report E-2023080839

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-07T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-25
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted and that one of the metal 5 gallon can of cibond (un1133) had been crushed by other freight and had released 1 quart of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the poly 10 gallon jug of MEKP-900 (un3105) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 1 gallon of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.
